New Records: Josh Hart became the first Knicks player since Michael Ray Richardson in 1981 with consecutive triple-doubles.
Josh Hart became the fourth player to have 10 triple-doubles with the Knicks.
Key Match Events: Karl-Anthony Towns had 31 points and 21 rebounds.
Josh Hart notched his second straight triple-double with 15 points, 14 rebounds and 12 assists.
The New York Knicks won their ninth straight game, beating the Utah Jazz 119-103.
Pre-Game Insights: The Knicks had to change plans after Deuce McBride developed left hamstring tightness during warmups.
Tyler Kolek played 12 minutes off the bench after logging 40 minutes earlier in the day.
Post-Match Reflections: The Knicks had no trouble without Jalen Brunson, shooting 55% from the field.
The Jazz lost their fifth straight game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Knicks have won 14 of their last 16 games.
The Jazz guards tried to keep Utah in the game but it was far too tough a task with Lauri Markkanen shooting just 6 for 22 en route to his 16 points.
Others: The Knicks visit Oklahoma City on Friday.
The Jazz are at Miami on Saturday.
